page.title: 12INDUSTRY IN BILSTHORPE
page.content: The biggest industry is Mining, the colliery being sunk in 1928 and has an estimated life in excess of 25 yrs. They employ 1200 men and 17 canteen workers. The Coal Board built a housing estate and still owns 300 dwellings. It also has a sports field with Tennis Courts, Bowling Greens and Football Pitches. The company Daylay Eggs which is just outside the village employs approx 200 people, they produce Eggs and Chickens and related products. This was a much larger company and approx 150 people have been made redundant. The Guy Warwick clothing factory employ mostly women and have recently enlarged their premises, C.A.Stawson is the largest farmer in the district and farms a large acreage, he employs 24 regular employees added to in the summer by 52 casual workers.
